Package view

Interface ViewGUI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ViewGUIImpl
    public interface ViewGUI
    This is the view GUI interface for the Stocks application. This has various function descriptions to display the menu and values for the user on a Graphical user interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addFeatures​(Features features)
      This feeature initialises an object of the Features interface to interact with the controller implementation class.
      void createOptions()
      This method prints the options for the flexible portfolio creation menu on the GUI.
      void dcaInvested100()
      This method throws a success pop up if the sum of percentages of money invested in stocks reaches 100%.
      void dcaStockAdded()
      This method throws a success pop up if stock is added successfully while investing money via strategies.
      void drawGraph​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> axisForGraph)
      This method is responsible for drawing the performance graph (a line chart).
      void errorCommFee()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid commission fee.
      void errorDate()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid date.
      void errorDateMarketClosed()
      This method displays an error pop up if user tries to buy on a holiday (i.e.
      void errorFileUpload()
      This method displays an error pop up if user uploads an invalid xml file.
      void errorInterval()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid interval during DCA type of investment.
      void errorInvtAmt()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid investment amount.
      void errorNs()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid number of shares.
      void errorPerc()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters incorrect percentage for splitting their invested amount.
      void errorPfName()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid investment amount.
      void errorPfName2()
      This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid portfolio name.
      void errorSell()
      This method displays an error pop up if user tries to sell more number of shares than he owns.
      void fileUploadSuccess()
      This method displays a success pop up if user uploads a valid xml file.
      void getCreateByInvtOncePage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
      This method displays the frame for creating portfolio by investing money on a specific date on the GUI.
      void getCreatePage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
      This method displays the frame where the user can enter the new portfolio details.
      void getDcaPage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
      This method displays the frame for creating portfolio by investing money using dollar cost averaging method.
      void getFlexibleMenu()
      This method prints the main menu on the GUI.
      void getGraphPage()
      This method displays the frame for getting inputs from user for viewing performance graph of a portfolio.
      void getModifyPage()
      This method displays a frame which takes the inputs from user for modifying a portfolio.
      void getPfNameAndDate()
      This method displays a frame which takes the portfolio name and date.
      void modifyStocks​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
      This method displays the frame for displaying the ways in which user can modify a portfolio.
      void outputPage​(java.lang.String output)
      This method prints the frame for total or cost basis or composition of the GUI.
      void portfolioSuccess​(java.lang.String purpose)
      This method displays a success pop up if portfolio is created successfully.
      void stockModifiedSuccess()
      This method displays a success pop up if portfolio is modified properly.
      void uploadFile()
      This method displays a frame allowing the user to load an existing portfolio.

    • Method Detail

      • getFlexibleMenu

        void getFlexibleMenu()
        This method prints the main menu on the GUI.

      • addFeatures

        void addFeatures​(Features features)
        This feeature initialises an object of the Features interface to interact with the controller implementation class.
        Parameters:
        features - object of the Features interface.

      • createOptions

        void createOptions()
        This method prints the options for the flexible portfolio creation menu on the GUI.

      • getCreatePage

        void getCreatePage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
        This method displays the frame where the user can enter the new portfolio details.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbolList - List of valid ticker symbols.

      • errorPfName

        void errorPfName()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid investment amount. An invalid portfolio name here is a portfolio which user is trying to create but already exists. For creating the user has to enter a unique portfolio name everytime.

      • errorPfName2

        void errorPfName2()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid portfolio name. An invalid portfolio name here is a portfolio which user is trying to access for composition, modification, total etc which is never created (not present in xml).

      • errorCommFee

        void errorCommFee()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid commission fee. An invalid commission fee is a non-positive number.

      • errorInvtAmt

        void errorInvtAmt()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid investment amount. An invalid investment amount is a non-positive amount.

      • errorDate

        void errorDate()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid date. Invalid date is a date which is not in yyyy-MM-dd format.

      • errorNs

        void errorNs()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid number of shares.

      • stockModifiedSuccess

        void stockModifiedSuccess()
        This method displays a success pop up if portfolio is modified properly.

      • errorDateMarketClosed

        void errorDateMarketClosed()
        This method displays an error pop up if user tries to buy on a holiday (i.e. when market is closed).

      • getGraphPage

        void getGraphPage()
        This method displays the frame for getting inputs from user for viewing performance graph of a portfolio.

      • getDcaPage

        void getDcaPage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
        This method displays the frame for creating portfolio by investing money using dollar cost averaging method.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbolList - list of valid ticker symbols for combo box.

      • dcaStockAdded

        void dcaStockAdded()
        This method throws a success pop up if stock is added successfully while investing money via strategies.

      • dcaInvested100

        void dcaInvested100()
        This method throws a success pop up if the sum of percentages of money invested in stocks reaches 100%. It informs the user that they cannot invest in more stocks in this transaction.

      • errorPerc

        void errorPerc()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters incorrect percentage for splitting their invested amount.

      • getPfNameAndDate

        void getPfNameAndDate()
        This method displays a frame which takes the portfolio name and date. Its a common frame which is used for composition, total or cost basis.

      • outputPage

        void outputPage​(java.lang.String output)
        This method prints the frame for total or cost basis or composition of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        output - amount or composition (string)

      • errorInterval

        void errorInterval()
        This method displays an error pop up if user enters invalid interval during DCA type of investment.

      • portfolioSuccess

        void portfolioSuccess​(java.lang.String purpose)
        This method displays a success pop up if portfolio is created successfully.
        Parameters:
        purpose - text for displaying whether portfolio was 'created' or 'modified'.

      • uploadFile

        void uploadFile()
        This method displays a frame allowing the user to load an existing portfolio.

      • fileUploadSuccess

        void fileUploadSuccess()
        This method displays a success pop up if user uploads a valid xml file.

      • errorFileUpload

        void errorFileUpload()
        This method displays an error pop up if user uploads an invalid xml file.

      • getModifyPage

        void getModifyPage()
        This method displays a frame which takes the inputs from user for modifying a portfolio.

      • modifyStocks

        void modifyStocks​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
        This method displays the frame for displaying the ways in which user can modify a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbolList - list of valid ticker symbols for combo box.

      • errorSell

        void errorSell()
        This method displays an error pop up if user tries to sell more number of shares than he owns.

      • getCreateByInvtOncePage

        void getCreateByInvtOncePage​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tickerSymbolList)
        This method displays the frame for creating portfolio by investing money on a specific date on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbolList - list of valid ticker symbols for combo box.

      • drawGraph

        void drawGraph​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> axisForGraph)
        This method is responsible for drawing the performance graph (a line chart).
        Parameters:
        axisForGraph - key value pair for x-y axis values.
